------=_NextPart_000_012B_01C9FEF3.91B7F530
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Evert,
 
Yeah, I've re-architected NEAT in such a way as to be compatible for the
Boost Graph Library - or any other graph library for that matter.  I posted
the general namespaces to this list about a month ago. If you would like
specifics, I can send you the code (in C#)  The advantange of this form of
separation of concerns is the ability to easily configure a graph library as
the foundation structure for any derived network, neural network, and/or
genome then extend this to NEAT or HyperNEAT.
 
A lot of this decision to use Boost or other graph library is predicated on
the way it handles n-dimensional vertices (either simple or complex)
associated with the nodes.
 
Ken Lloyd
 
=================
Kenneth A. Lloyd
CEO & Director Systems Science
Watt Systems Technologies Inc.
kalloyd@...
kenneth.lloyd@...
505-918-6988 Cellular direct
www.wattsys.com
 
 

  _____  

From: neat@yahoogroups.com [mailto:neat@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
evertwh2004
Sent: Tuesday, July 07, 2009 7:55 AM
To: neat@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [neat] Re: HyperNEAT substrate definition & visualisation





Thanks Nicolai - that's great. Not a GUI, but still great :-).

I know that boost::graph can read these files - have you (or anyone else)
tried converting boost::graph structures into NEAT networks?

Cheers,

Evert

--- In neat@yahoogroups. <mailto:neat%40yahoogroups.com> com, "Nikolai"
<ker_31_toluca@...> wrote:
>
> --- In neat@yahoogroups. <mailto:neat%40yahoogroups.com> com,
"evertwh2004" <evert@> wrote:
> 
> > Does anyone know of available visualisation tools or code?
> > 
> 
> it is possible to visualize networks with graphviz, together with gifview
program from gifsicle tools for gif animation.
> here is an example of a network in .dot language, you run it with command:
dot -Tgif test1.dot |gifview
> ==============/ test1.dot /==============
> digraph net {
> rankdir=TB;
> constraint=false;
> ranksep="0.5 equaly";
> // Comment
> node [shape=circle];
> {
> rank=min;
> 1 [color=blue]
> 2 [color=blue]
> 3 [color=blue]
> 4 [color=green]
> }
> { 
> node [shape=circle];
> {
> 7
> 8
> 9
> 10
> 11
> 12
> 13
> 14
> }
> }
> {
> rank=max;
> node [shape=circle];
> {
> 5 [color=magenta]
> 6 [color=magenta]
> }
> }
> 1->7
> 1->8
> 2->7
> 2->9
> 3->7
> 3->6
> 4->9
> 4->6
> 4->5
> 4->12
> 5->7
> 5->8
> 7->10
> 7->11
> 6->10
> 8->14
> 8->9
> 9->12
> 9->13
> 10->13
> 11->5
> 12->6
> 12->5
> 13->6
> 14->5
> }
>
